TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and currently imprisoned in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON and Mr PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE .
A.
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant was taken into custody by police officers from ORG on suspicion of being a member of the ORG .
On DATE the ORG ordered the applicant ’s detention on remand .

On DATE the public prosecutor attached to ORG filed a bill of indictment against the applicant and CARDINAL other accused . He charged the applicant with being a member of the ORG and with involvement in bombing of a fuel station . The prosecutor requested that the applicant be convicted and sentenced under LAW of LAW and LAW .

On DATE ORG convicted the applicant on account of his involvement in the ORG and the bombing of a fuel station . The court sentenced the applicant to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment under LAW , CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL of LAW and LAW .
On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE on procedural grounds .

At a hearing on DATE the ORG refused the applicant ’s request for release pending trial . The court considered that the applicant ’s detention on remand was necessary having regard to the serious nature of the alleged offences , the date on which he had been detained on remand and the state of evidence .
At a hearing on DATE the court again rejected the applicant ’s request for release pending trail on the same grounds .

On DATE the applicant filed an objection with ORG against the refusal of his request for release pending trail . The applicant emphasised that his detention pending trial constituted a violation of his rights guaranteed under LAW of LAW .

On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant on account of his involvement in the ORG and organising and planning to bomb a fuel station . The court sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment in respect of the first offence under LAW and LAW and to DATE and DATE and DATE imprisonment , together with a fine of MONEY , in respect of the second offence under LAW . The court did not reply to the applicant ’s objection of CARDINAL DATE . The court also convicted and sentenced CARDINAL other accused .
On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .
B. Relevant domestic law and practice
i. DATE LAW provides :
“ Everyone has the right to liberty and security of person .

A person deprived of his liberty , for whatever reason , shall have the right to take proceedings before a judicial authority which shall give a speedy ruling on his case and order his immediate release if it finds that the deprivation of liberty was unlawful .
Compensation must be paid by the ORG , as the law shall provide , for damage sustained by persons who have been victims of treatment contrary to the above provisions . ”
ii . The relevant provision of LAW reads as follows :
Article CARDINAL

“ Any person who , with the intention of committing the offences defined in Articles ... , forms an armed gang or organisation or takes leadership … or command of such a gang or organisation or assumes some special responsibility within it shall be sentenced to not less than fifteen years’ imprisonment .
The other members of the gang or organisation shall be sentenced to not CARDINAL and not more than fifteen years’ imprisonment . ”

Under section CARDINAL of the Prevention of Terrorism Act ( Law no . CARDINAL of DATE ) , the offence defined in LAW is classified as a “ terrorist act ” . Pursuant to LAW no . ORG , penalties laid down in LAW as punishment for the offences defined in LAW are increased by CARDINAL .
iii . Section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL on the payment of compensation to persons arrested or detained provides :
“ Compensation shall be paid by the ORG in respect of all damage sustained by persons
( CARDINAL ) who have been arrested , or detained under conditions or in circumstances incompatible with the LAW or statute law ;
( CARDINAL ) who have not been immediately informed of the reasons for their arrest or detention ;
( CARDINAL ) who have not been brought before a judicial officer after being arrested or detained within the time - limit laid down by statute for that purpose ;
( CARDINAL ) who have been deprived of their liberty without a court order after the statutory time - limit for being brought before a judicial officer has expired ;
( CARDINAL ) whose close family have not been immediately informed of their arrest or detention ;
( CARDINAL ) who , after being arrested or detained in accordance with the law , are not subsequently committed for trial … , or are acquitted or discharged after standing trial ; or
( CARDINAL ) who have been sentenced to a period of imprisonment shorter than the period spent in detention or ordered to pay a pecuniary penalty only … ”
